roleset.name: to take something from by fraud

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Last November , a federal grand jury indicted GE-1 on charges of fraud and false claims in connection with an alleged scheme [*]-1 to defraud the Army of $ 21 million [*U*]on a logistics computer contract .

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: The Justice Department said [0] it filed a lawsuit seeking more than $ 7.7 million [*U*]from a Meredith Corp. unit on charges that the company defrauded the government on a contract [*] to provide relocation services for federal employees .
example.arg: a contract [*] to provide relocation services for federal employees

example.name: with Arg3
example.text: Shearson was sued [*-1] by money manager George Soros , who [*T*-3]claimed [0] [one of his funds] was defrauded [*] out of $ 60 million [*U*] during stock-index futures trading just after the 1987 crash .

roleset.note: DEFRAUD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'defraud' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from defraud.01-v predicate notes)
